meanings.definition: A large board or electronic display on which the score of a game or match is shown.
meanings.sent1: The scoreboard at the baseball game displayed the score for everyone to see.
meanings.sent2: I glanced at the scoreboard to check the score of the basketball game.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel mistook the scoreboard for a tree and tried to climb it.
meanings.sent4: Her face was like a scoreboard, revealing every emotion she felt.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights of the scoreboard lit up the stadium, making it feel magical.

meanings.definition: To keep track of the score on a scoreboard.
meanings.sent1: We need to scoreboard the points for each team accurately.
meanings.sent2: He scoreboarded the results of the competition diligently.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to scoreboard the number of times it caught a mouse.
meanings.sent4: She scoreboarded her progress in learning a new language, feeling accomplished.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to scoreboard their quiz scores to monitor their improvement.
